page.title: 14LANGUAGE
page.content: ACCENTS As so much of the population is from other parts of the country, a wide variety of accents can be heard within the area, from North Scottish, through South Scotland, Cumbria, Northumbrian, Yorkshire, the Midlands, right through to London, Wales and the West Country. DIALECT The "Lanky Twang" (local dialect) can still be heard from the older inhabitants. Phrases like "Whee'r ta bahn?" (Where are you going) or "Tha gret niddi'ommer", (You stupid fellow) cause confusion among newcomers who have to use their discretion in many cases, not liking to show their ignorance. FOREIGN LANGUAGES All families in the area speak English, at present. Most children are taught French or German at Secondary School.
